Header: Four new Ambassadors hand over credentials to President
Content: New envoys have been appointed to Sri Lanka from four foreign countries. They have handed in their credentials to President Maithripala Sirisena. The new Ambassadors have been appointed from the United States, Japan, France and Afghanistan. New Ambassador from the United States Alaina Teplitz first presented her credentials to the President. She was followed by the new Ambassador from Japan Akira Sugiyama. New Ambassador of France to Sri Lanka Eric Lavertu handed over his credentials to the President. The new Ambassador of Afghanistan to Sri Lanka is Ashraf Haidari. He too handed over his credentials to the President. Foreign Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama, Presidential Secretary Udaya R. Seneviratne and Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Ariyasinghe were present on the occasion.
